endgames.name: King and Pawn vs King
endgames.description: Learn how to promote a pawn with only the king's help
keyPoints: The king must support the pawn's advance
Opposition is crucial in pawn endgames
Know when to push and when to wait

endgames.name: King and Rook vs King
endgames.description: Master the most common endgame - checkmate with king and rook
keyPoints: Cut off the enemy king with the rook
Use your king to support the rook
Drive the king to the edge of the board

endgames.name: King and Queen vs King
endgames.description: The simplest checkmate - learn the proper technique
keyPoints: Don't stalemate! Keep squares for the enemy king
Use the queen to control squares
Bring your king closer to help

endgames.name: King and Two Bishops vs King
endgames.description: Checkmate with two bishops - requires precise coordination
keyPoints: The bishops work together to control diagonals
Drive the king to a corner
Your king must support the bishops

endgames.name: King, Bishop and Knight vs King
endgames.description: The most difficult basic checkmate - requires perfect technique
keyPoints: This is the hardest basic checkmate
Must drive king to corner matching bishop's color
Requires precise coordination of all pieces

endgames.name: Rook Pawn vs King (Edge Case)
endgames.description: Special case: rook pawns are harder to promote
keyPoints: Rook pawns are trickier than center pawns
The defending king can sometimes draw
Know when promotion is possible

endgames.name: King and Queen vs King and Rook
endgames.description: Winning endgame but requires technique to avoid perpetual check
keyPoints: Avoid perpetual check by keeping pieces coordinated
Use your king actively
Trade the rook when possible

endgames.name: The Opposition
endgames.description: Master the fundamental concept of opposition in king and pawn endgames
keyPoints: Opposition means kings face each other with one square between
The player who doesn't have the move has the opposition
Opposition is crucial for winning pawn endgames

endgames.name: Zugzwang
endgames.description: When any move makes your position worse
keyPoints: Zugzwang forces the opponent to make a bad move
Common in endgames with few pieces
Patience is key - wait for the right moment

endgames.name: Triangulation
endgames.description: Lose a tempo by moving your king in a triangle
keyPoints: Triangulation lets you pass the move to your opponent
Useful when you need to gain opposition
Requires careful calculation
